author: Alan Buckner
comment: Excellent app!  I tried countless other options and finally found this one which worked great.  I specifically have chosen photos that make me smile - that way I am smiling all day long :-)  Note that you manage the app through the Android Wear app, not it's on phone app.  I'm going to give this 5 stars because I'm thrilled, but I would suggest two options:  a) Add the day/date as an option on the clock.  b) Add folders in the photo selection box - all photos together is difficult to manage.  To make this easy, I use Google Photos only for my watch faces and select them all after cropping square.  Makes them easy to manage.  Again, VERY satisfied with this app.

author: Jeffrey Fonseca
comment: Now I can toggle my photos to show to people, works pretty good for photos from phone or web.  Just wish I could tell before I select a photo how it will appear on my LG Urbane as a couple of photos get the heads cut off on the watch.  Don't notice any battery hit either, so suspect it is caching the photos on the watch.
title: Simple and wows

author: Mark Holmes
comment: With a huawei and nexus 5x the photos don't seem to rotate. Stuck with one pic even though mult are selected. Also took me a while to figure out that I needed to manage photos through Android wear app versus another app(newbie to Android wear). Once I figured that out no real navigation issues other than trying to figure out how to get the pics to rotate.
title: Works ok

author: Ned Jeffery
comment: Works OK. I don't like that the dimmed mode is not black and white, that wastes battery. App design is annoying, but it's not a big deal. And please add more than 2 options for the watch face with different designs.
title: Good idea, poor design.

author: Doug Edwards
comment: After installing go into the Android Wear app on your phone and select the Your Photos watch face.  You can then select one or more photos from your phone to show as your watch face.  The watch face is changed each time your watch comes out of dim mode.  NEAT!
title: Just what I wanted

author: Robert Biediger
comment: I searched for hours for an app that does EXACTLY THIS!!  Thank you!  FYI: the image selector is random.  If you have thousands of images on your phone, it makes finding a specific one difficult.  I had to use the "menu" key (not all androids have'em) to select the sorting order. (Newest first) To clear previously selected images, you have to go to "app info" > "clear data"

author: Clio Mouse
comment: Functions well enough, but there's GOT to be a better way to browse pictures! Mine are all organized by photo, but this ap dumps them all into ONE album. Phone memory is big, especially with an external card, people! I can't scroll thru 15k pictures to select the few I want.
title: Holy picture-scrolling, Batman!

author: rickycowslip
comment: makes all other faces redundant, only downside is that it tends to crash when selecting photes from phone, could just be my phone. Thanks for app Jim
title: Fave watch face

author: Justen DeBowles
comment: Been looking at a ton of significantly difficult watch face creators when all I wanted to do was put my own picture as the background on my G watch. Thank you for keeping it simple!
title: Exactly what I wanted!

author: Irving Friend
comment: Decent but I have over 9000 photos and it crashes on me. I was however able to load quite a bit, 1000 or so, on to it before it starting crashing

author: Sandra Houle
comment: Installed it, but can't find any way to open it. There is no shortcut icon, and no way to open it from Google Play. Samsung Galaxy Note 4

author: Christian Staxx
comment: maybe some slight adjustment options the access to photos is kinda weird but again great for what I wanted. using my pics for my watch face
title: does what it needs says

author: Brad J. Mintie
comment: Need an option for those of us that do not leave the screen on all the time.  Right now just reloads same picture.  Thanks.

author: Paul Chapman
comment: I love this, allowed me to fully create my own watch faces, combine it with a photo studio or art app and the options are near infinite.
title: My favourite watch app

author: Kevin Thompson
comment: Out of the hundreds of watch faces this is by far the best. What's better than seeing the thousands of digital pictures you take every time you look at your watch? This has never frozen the watch and the photos change every time the watch wakes up.
title: This is my favorite

author: Tara Goode
comment: It doesn't even show up as an app to open and work
title: Not there

author: Charles Chuateco
comment: Hey @Jim, love this app. But for some reason once I uncheck a photo it still shows as a watch face. Suggestions? I've already reset my watch and reinstalled the app.
title: Great app, but need assist

author: Neetu Kaur
comment: Not able to view this app in my mobile after installing it

author: Harikrishnan Adityan
comment: I am getting error while selecting "choose photos from your phonr"
title: Excellent product

author: David Wagstaff
comment: A nice app letting me look at my photos when checking the time.

author: John Marion
comment: I've taken some cool images that give me very cool, one of a kind watch faces

author: Rachel Lockett
comment: I love that you can set it to pick up photos from facebook and Google at the same time.

author: Purple Space
comment: The app worked before the 2.0 update,but not the photos don't change and just stay one the last photo you picked.

author: Tonya Catron
comment: I love the app I love being able to see my family on my wrist it works wonderfully. I just can't figure out how to delete the photos that are on the watch

author: Ta Kabler
comment: Will not even open up only option showing is uninstall.

author: Marco Jackson
comment: I can't get to my photos... Please let me know how to...

author: Ankit Kothari
comment: The app doesn't show open option on my phone. It doesn't even show up in apps drawer. Pls correct.

author: Pjay Pender
comment: No documentation. There seems to be no way to add photos

author: Karol C
comment: Doesn't work at all

author: HanFar
comment: Working on SW3 but need more style of clock

author: Xander Warrender
comment: What more needs said.  Pick a picture and BAM, it's on my watch.
title: Nice and simple

author: Paul David Santana
comment: Only wish I could move the digital time instead of just the middle
title: Simple. Brilliant.

author: Ali Abbas
comment: Wow superb ,thanks alot guys ...excellent app ,that too for free....well-done

author: Angie chetty
comment: Won't even open on my phone

author: Anthony Marshall
comment: Easy to use and does what you want it to 😊

author: Mandy Morrison
comment: No icon only option was to uninstall

author: Adrian York
comment: Only option was Uninstall, so I did. 😂
It's amazing for Android but plz make this type of app for iOS system

comment: Doesnt work
